intro: Clematopsis trifida, commonly known as the three-leaf clematopsis, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets arranged symmetrically. It produces small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Clematopsis trifida is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat.
